qas.question: What conquistador landed in Florida in 1539
Who established early settlements in Florida

answers.text: Both the Spanish and French established settlements

qas.question: Who established 1 of the first Us settlements in Florida

answers.text: Don Tristán de Luna y Arellano

qas.question: What people were discovered by early settlers of Florida
What did Spanish settlers introduce to Florida

answers.text: Christianity, cattle, horses, sheep, the Spanish language, and more

plausible_answers.text: Hernando de Soto skirted the coast of Florida

qas.question: What coast did Hernando de Soto not find?
What wasn't Hernando de Soto looking for?

plausible_answers.text: wall of red mangroves spread mile after mile

qas.question: What didn't Hernando de Soto see?

context: "By May 1539, Conquistador <a0_0><b5_0>Hernando de Soto<a0_0/> skirted the coast of <b6_0>Florida<b6_0/><b5_0/>, searching for a <b7_0>deep harbor to land<b7_0/>. He described seeing a thick <b8_0>wall of red mangroves spread mile after mile<b8_0/>, some reaching as high as 70 feet (21 m), with intertwined and elevated roots making landing difficult. Very soon, 'many smokes' appeared 'along the whole coast', billowing against the sky, when the <a3_0>Native ancestors of the Seminole<a3_0/> spotted the newcomers and spread the alarm by signal fires". The Spanish introduced <a4_0>Christianity, cattle, horses, sheep, the Spanish language, and more<a4_0/> to Florida.[full citation needed] <a1_0>Both the Spanish and French established settlements<a1_0/> in Florida, with varying degrees of success. In 1559, <a2_0>Don Tristán de Luna y Arellano<a2_0/> established a colony at present-day <b9_0>Pensacola<b9_0/>, one of the first European settlements in the continental United States, but it was abandoned by 1561.
